cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi (375 km) east of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW then NW, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, and track northwest across the south-central Gulf toward the north-western Gulf Coast (upper Texas–Louisiana region) early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near south-central Louisiana or the upper Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla including the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of Honduras, Yucatan Peninsula, and later the northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but uncertain (dependent on westward shift in track)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤15%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts generally below 40 mph expected at this time.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (<3 ft) possible on the Upper Texas coast if the system shifts farther west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals if the track shifts closer to the Texas coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the approaches to Galveston Bay and coastal channels.
